attributes.action: Provide £1000 Compensation to All Affected by the HMRC Breach of the Data Protection Act
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
HMRC should provide all families affected by the loss of personal data with a minimum £1000 compensation payment per person with the addition of any specific damages resulting from the loss.  This should include compensation for the lowering of credit ratings caused by the loss of data and the subsequent loans being applied for fraudulently, etc.

HMRC has breached the Data Protection Act and as a Data Controller they are duty bound to provide compensation in accordance with Chapter 3 para 13 part 2b.  Can HMG show that they operate above and beyond the law or should they follow the law and pay the compensation?

reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
